item.title: Color palettes in R
item.description: R packages ggsci MapPalettes nationalparkcolors wesanderson viridis RColorBrewer _brewer() function from ggplot2 Websites colorbrewer 2.0 open color ggplot color best tricks you will love Top R color palettes to know for great data visualization R packages ggsci Scientific Journal and Sci-Fi Themed Color Palettes for ggplot2 NPG: scale_color_npg() and scale_fill_npg() AAAS: scale_color_aaas() and scale_fill_aaas() NEJM Lancet JAMA JCO UCSCGB D3 LocusZoom IGV UChicago Star Trek Tron Legacy Futurama Rick and Morty The Simpsons pacman::p_load(dplyr, ggplot2) mtcars %>% filter(carb <= 4) %>% ggplot(aes(mpg, gear, color = factor(carb))) + geom_point(size = 4) + theme_classic() + ggsci::scale_color_npg() MapPalettes MapPalettes green_machine, irish_flag, tealberry_pie, sunset, the_joker, bruiser # devtools::install_github("disarm-platform/MapPalettes") pacman::p_load(dplyr, ggplot2, MapPalettes) mtcars %>% filter(carb <= 4) %>% ggplot(aes(mpg, gear, color = factor(carb))) + geom_point(size = 4) + theme_classic() + scale_color_manual(values = MapPalettes::map_palette("tealberry_pie", 4)) nationalparkcolors nationalparkcolors # devtools::install_github("katiejolly/nationalparkcolors") pacman::p_load(dplyr, ggplot2, nationalparkcolors) mtcars %>% filter(carb <= 4) %>% ggplot(aes(mpg, gear, color = factor(carb))) + geom_point(size = 4) + theme_classic() + scale_color_manual(values = nationalparkcolors::park_palette("MtRainier", 4)) wesanderson wesanderson R package GitHub Wes Anderson Palettes pacman::p_load(wesanderson) names(wes_palettes) ## [1] "BottleRocket1" "BottleRocket2" "Rushmore1" "Rushmore" ## [5] "Royal1" "Royal2" "Zissou1" "Darjeeling1" ## [9] "Darjeeling2" "Chevalier1" "FantasticFox1" "Moonrise1" ## [13] "Moonrise2" "Moonrise3" "Cavalcanti1" "GrandBudapest1" ## [17] "GrandBudapest2" "IsleofDogs1" "IsleofDogs2" # devtools::install_github("karthik/wesanderson") pacman::p_load(dplyr, ggplot2, wesanderson) mtcars %>% filter(carb <= 4) %>% ggplot(aes(mpg, gear, color = factor(carb))) + geom_point(size = 4) + theme_classic() + scale_color_manual(values = wesanderson::wes_palette(n = 4, name = "GrandBudapest1")) viridis viridis

item.title: 高影响力期刊发表，那些编辑和你的导师没有告诉过你的不成文的秘密
item.description: 此部分大部分来自于本人在美国队伍军人事务部临床流行病研究中心的工作经验。 期刊选择 主题的影响力和新颖程度 方法和数据分析的艺术性 投稿期刊的选择 作者组成 你所在的研究小组 信号与噪声：不牢靠的结果

item.title: 学术英文例句学习
item.description: The effect of cardiovascular outcomes has been less well characterized. The Trouble With Trucking But those drivers are the top echelon of the occupation and are not representative of the hundreds of thousands of people who toil in the industry’s underbelly. The previous requirements raised the cost of moving goods and stifled competition, but deregulation also took a toll on drivers by giving the industry a bigger financial incentive to lower costs and by weakening unions.

item.title: Data visualization using ggplot2
item.description: Kaplan-Meier survival plots using survminer One Kaplan-Meier plot using survminer survminer::ggsurvplot(survfit(utotalPSM ~ integ, data = total), pval = TRUE, conf.int = TRUE, legend.title = "Hospital type", legend.labs = c("Ordinary Hospitals", "Medical Consortium Hospitals"), submain = "Kaplan-Meier plot for a pool of three patient cohorts", xlab = "Survival length of stay", palette = c("firebrick1", "green4"), font.submain = c(16, "bold")) Arrange 3 survival plots plot3cohorts = survminer::arrange_ggsurvplots( list(ggfei.m, ggwei.m, ggshiguan.m), nrow = 3, ncol = 1) Code and data.

item.title: Rmarkdown .pdf tricks
item.description: LaTeX Header To make a lot of tricks work, you need to header-includes: - \usepackage{setspace}: spacing \doublespacing \singlespacing \linespread{1.5} - \AtBeginDocument{\let\maketitle\relax}: do not make title - \usepackage{lineno} \linenumbers - \usepackage[bottom]{footmisc}: make footnote on the first page to bottom - \usepackage{dcolumn}: to make stargazer tables work - \usepackage{lscape}: \newcommand{\blandscape}{\begin{landscape}} \newcommand{\elandscape}{\end{landscape}} Make a box around the content: \fbox{\begin{minipage}{\linewidth} 1. (11 Points: 2,3,3,3) Researchers are interested in .
